citeinfo.title: HRC KB26 SCC Aerial Surveys Feb 2014

descript.abstract: Features in this feature class represent animal sightings recorded during aerial monitoring surveys for marine mammals and sea turtles performed in February 2014 in the Hawaii Range Complex (HRC). Aerial surveys were conducted in conjunction with the Submarine Commanderâ€™s Course (SCC) naval training event in HRC on the Pacific Missile Range Facility (PMRF) Barking Sands Tactical Underwater Range and Barking Sands Underwater Range Extension between Kauai and Niihau, Hawaii during the period 18 February through 20 February 2014. The SCC training event occurred from 17 to 20 February 2014, in waters adjoining Kauai and Niihau, and involved surface ships, submarines, and aircraft. The approach involved flying elliptical-shaped patterns in advance of the cruiser (CG), which extended from the front of the ship (approximately 200 meters) out to approximately 2,500 meters over a width of 5 km. The survey platform was a small fixed-wing Aero Commander 500. Work was performed under HDR task order KB26 (IDIQ contract award N62470-10-D-3011, NAVFAC LANT).

idinfo.accconst: Open public unless otherwise noted. See Use Constraints for details.
idinfo.useconst:
Provider-specific constraints: Data use constraints are consistent with those outlined in Appendix B (Data Use Agreement) for NAVFAC contract N62470-10-D-3011.
OBIS-SEAMAP constraints: 1. Not to use data obtained from OBIS-SEAMAP in any publication, product, or commercial application without proper attribution to the original data provider(s) and OBIS-SEAMAP unless the datasets are explicitly shown under the CC0 policy. Citations or credits are suggested as attribution. If the data you downloaded come from multiple datasets, a citation or credit to each of the datasets is required.
Suggested citation for this dataset:
Ampela, K. and G. Miller-Francisco. 2016. HRC KB26 SCC Aerial Surveys Feb 2014. Data downloaded from OBIS-SEAMAP (http://seamap.env.duke.edu/dataset/1392) on yyyy-mm-dd.
Suggested citation for OBIS-SEAMAP:
Halpin, P.N., A.J. Read, E. Fujioka, B.D. Best, B. Donnelly, L.J. Hazen, C. Kot, K. Urian, E. LaBrecque, A. Dimatteo, J. Cleary, C. Good, L.B. Crowder, and K.D. Hyrenbach. 2009. OBIS-SEAMAP: The world data center for marine mammal, sea bird, and sea turtle distributions. Oceanography 22(2):104-115
2. To forward the citation of any publication / report that made use of the data / tools provided by OBIS-SEAMAP for inclusion in our list of references.
3. Not to hold OBIS-SEAMAP or the original data providers liable for errors in the data. While we have made every effort to ensure the quality of the database, we cannot guarantee the accuracy of these datasets.
4. The burden for determining fitness for use of the downloaded data for any analyses lies entirely with the user. OBIS-SEAMAP or the original data providers do not support outcomes of your analyses that used the data you downloaded from OBIS-SEAMAP.
5. To consider inclusion of the accompanying transect (effort) dataset if available into the methodology of your analyses.
6. Not to redistribute the data you downloaded from OBIS-SEAMAP through any media without contect from OBIS-SEAMAP and the original data providers unless the datasets are explicitly shown under the CC0 policy.

cntperp.cntorg: HDR Environmental, Operations and Construction, Inc.; HDR Environmental, Operations and Construction, Inc.

idinfo.datacred: The U.S. Navy Marine Species Monitoring Program

citeinfo.origin: Halpin, P.N., A.J. Read, E. Fujioka, B.D. Best, B. Donnelly, L.J. Hazen, C. Kot, K. Urian, E. LaBrecque, A. Dimatteo, J. Cleary, C. Good, L.B. Crowder, and K.D. Hyrenbach
citeinfo.title: OBIS-SEAMAP: The world data center for marine mammal, sea bird, and sea turtle distributions

attracc.attraccr: All attributes were measured and recorded during the survey and validated by the data provider.

dataqual.logic: Permissible values for date and time and coordinates were validated by the data provider and the OBIS-SEAMAP data manager. Species identification by the data provider was matched with Integrated Taxonomic Information System.

procstep.procdesc: Data were put through the OBIS-SEAMAP data registration steps.

attr.attrdef: Unique ID number (generated by OBIS-SEAMAP)

attrdomv.udom: Unique ID number (generated by OBIS-SEAMAP)

attr.attrdef: Unique ID number
The altitude of the observation platform (plane, vessel bridge, etc) above sea level in meters
A calculation based on multiple resights, calculating the distance travelled by the time elapsed between sighting events
The area in km2 over which the survey took place
Bathymetric slope aspect at location of animal
Relative bearing from the platform to the sighting, where the front of the platform is zero degrees. Formats include clock face, degrees, etc.
True (not magnetic) bearing to sighting. Calculated from relative bearing and platform bearing.
Beaufort sea state (0-12)
Beaufort sea state on the left (port) side of the platform (0-12)
Beaufort sea state on the right (starboard) side of the platform (0-12)
Initial behavioral state of the animal or group when first observed. Examples: Travel, Mill, Rest

attrdomv.udom: Initial behavioral state of the animal or group when first observed. Examples: Travel, Mill, Rest

attr.attrdef: Discrete behavioral event(s) observed during the sighting. Examples: Breach, Tail Slap, Blow

attrdomv.udom: Discrete behavioral event(s) observed during the sighting. Examples: Breach, Tail Slap, Blow

attr.attrdef: Was a biopsy attempted for the sighting?

attrdomv.udom: Was a biopsy attempted for the sighting?

attr.attrdef: Are birds present?

attrdomv.udom: Are birds present?

attr.attrdef: Are calves present? Use notes field to indicate number of calves present.

codesetd.codesetn: Are calves present? Use notes field to indicate number of calves present.

attr.attrdef: The number of calves in the sighting
The number of positively identified females in the sighting
The number of positively identified juveniles in the sightings
The number of positively identified males in the sighting
The number of positively identified newborns/pups in the sighting
The best estimate of the number of animals in the sighting
The highest estimate of the number of animals in the sighting
The lowest estimate of the number of animals in the sighting
The number of cargo ships present in the area
The number of ferries present in the area
The number of fishing boats present in the area
The number of military vessels present in the area
The number of motor yachts present in the area
The number of vessels in the area that do not fall into the above categories
The number of sailboats present in the area
The sighting cue that initially drew the observers attention

attrdomv.udom: The sighting cue that initially drew the observers attention

attr.attrdef: Date and Time together in one cell value (LOCAL TIME)
Date and Time together in one cell value (UTC)
The depth of the water at sighting location, based on known bathymetry
Depth as determined in situ via sounding
The maximum distance between nearest neighbors within a group (in body lengths)
The minimum distance between nearest neighbors within a group (in body lengths)
The radial distance to the animal
The perpendicular distance to the animal from the trackline

Indication of whether the survey team was actively searching with all designated observers focused on searching for marine mammal sighting cues. Options: On= dedicated observation effort with both observers on watch. If line, strip, or point transect - following formal distance sampling protocol regardless of survey mode (e.g. maintaining observation and platform protocols on a connector line). All other survey types - maintaining a consistent level of observation effort ; Off= not observing; If line, strip, or point transect - not following formal distance sampling protocol regardless of survey mode (e.g. platform speed or altitude is not consistent with protocol, incomplete observer effort, etc). All other survey types - no dedicated observation effort. Compormised= only one observer watching, observing through cloud/fog patches, dark, or other conditions that compromise ability to observe consistently

attrdomv.udom: Indication of whether the survey team was actively searching with all designated observers focused on searching for marine mammal sighting cues. Options: On= dedicated observation effort with both observers on watch. If line, strip, or point transect - following formal distance sampling protocol regardless of survey mode (e.g. maintaining observation and platform protocols on a connector line). All other survey types - maintaining a consistent level of observation effort ; Off= not observing; If line, strip, or point transect - not following formal distance sampling protocol regardless of survey mode (e.g. platform speed or altitude is not consistent with protocol, incomplete observer effort, etc). All other survey types - no dedicated observation effort. Compormised= only one observer watching, observing through cloud/fog patches, dark, or other conditions that compromise ability to observe consistently

attr.attrdef: The sequential daily flight identifier (e.g., 1, 2, 3, etc.)

attrdomv.udom: The sequential daily flight identifier (e.g., 1, 2, 3, etc.)

attr.attrdef: The amount of glare (0-100%) on the left (port) side of the platform. Refers to glare from 0 to 90 degrees, or viewshed for which observer is reponsible.
The amount of glare (0-100%) on the right (starboard) side of the platform. Refers to glare from 270-360 degrees, or viewshed for which observer is reponsible.
Identifier for a particular group within a sighting

attrdomv.udom: Identifier for a particular group within a sighting

attr.attrdef: Heading of the animal (sighting) at the time of the initial sighting (in degrees magnetic)
Heading of the observation platform relative to magnetic North
Heading of the observation platform relative to true North
Horizontal glare calculation on NOAA large vessel surveys
The calculated latitude of the animal at the initial time of the sighting
The latitude of the platform in decimal degrees
The latitude of the vessel(s) (NOT the survey platform) sighted during a survey
Letter or number for survey leg/transect

attrdomv.udom: Letter or number for survey leg/transect

attr.attrdef: Notes as entered for that particular leg of the survey

attrdomv.udom: Notes as entered for that particular leg of the survey

attr.attrdef: A unique identifier for the leg associated with the survey

attrdomv.udom: A unique identifier for the leg associated with the survey

attr.attrdef: A metric describing animal travel, calculated by dividing the distance between the first and last recorded sighting waypoints by the sum total of all distances between waypoints. Values range between 0 and 1, with a number closer to 1 representing a straight line and close to 0 representing no constant direction of the animal.?

attrdomv.udom: A metric describing animal travel, calculated by dividing the distance between the first and last recorded sighting waypoints by the sum total of all distances between waypoints. Values range between 0 and 1, with a number closer to 1 representing a straight line and close to 0 representing no constant direction of the animal.?

attr.attrdef: The calculated longitude of the animal (sighting) at the initial time of the sighting

overview.eaover: This section explains attributes included in the original dataset. OBIS-SEAMAP restricts the attributes available to the public to date/time, lat/lon and species names/counts only. Should you need other attributes described here, you are encouraged to contact the data provider.
